title: sexylun
author: sexylun
content: I am in strange trouble at the moment. I am logged in my browser but i have forgotten the password.I will remain login as long as i don't logout. Is there any way i can recover my password ?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: You can just use the forgot password feature[1] of the forum. If you still have the access of your registered email, then follow the step in the email that will be sent to you.Note: Don't recover your account by answering your secret question, you will face more trouble[2][1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=reminder[2] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1206977.0

comments.author: sexylun
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on January 31, 2023, 06:58:06 PMYou can just use the forgot password feature[1] of the forum. If you still have the access of your registered email, then follow the step in the email that will be sent to you.Note: Don't recover your account by answering your secret question, you will face more trouble[2][1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=reminder[2] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1206977.0I don't have access to email too. What are the options now ?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.created_time: January 31, 2023, 07:07:52 PMLast edit: January 31, 2023, 07:23:04 PM by PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: sexylun on January 31, 2023, 07:02:42 PMI don't have access to email too. What are the options now ?Why?Â  Is this the account you're talking to? If yes, then just create a new one. If not, i don't know either, why the hell you forgot those information in the very first place. Anyway, try your luck messaging Cyrus or the recovery team[1] to recover your account.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5089777.0

comments.author: Pandorak
comments.body: Quote from: PX-Z on January 31, 2023, 07:07:52 PMIs this the account you're talking to? If yes, then just create a new one. If not, i don't know either, why the hell you forgot and those information in the very first place. Anyway, try your luck messaging Cyrus or the recovery team[1] to recover your account.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5089777.0It seems he is talking about the account he used to create this topic, this is a very funny case, i see even in the link you provided, the 2 ways to recover the account still require an email, and he also lost his email.Quote from: sexylun on January 31, 2023, 07:02:42 PMI don't have access to email too. What are the options now ?It's better for you to create a new account than to think about how to recover this account.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.created_time: January 31, 2023, 07:33:48 PMLast edit: January 31, 2023, 08:05:57 PM by hosseinimr93
comments.body: Quote from: sexylun on January 31, 2023, 07:02:42 PMI don't have access to email too. What are the options now ?You can change your email address to a new one. To do so, go to your profile, click "Account Related Settings" under "Modify Profile" at left side of the page and enter your new email address. Once you change your email address, an email will be sent to your old email address. The email includes a link which can be used for locking the account and will work for 14 days. If no one has access to the old email address, this can be solution for you. Edit: Sorry. I didn't know it's not possible to change the email address if you don't know your password. So, what I suggested above can't work for OP.Thanks Stalker22 for the correction.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: Did you post your Bitcoin address here  Stake your Bitcoin address here New then follow this Recovering hacked/lost accounts  to recover your account.If you write down any Bitcoin address publicly and can sign a message from it, you may be able to recover your account, even if it is an altcoin address.Otherwise, try your luck by sending information that only the account owner knows, and then it will be a long process to recover your account.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.created_time: January 31, 2023, 07:42:41 PMLast edit: January 31, 2023, 07:57:34 PM by Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: sexylun on January 31, 2023, 07:02:42 PMI don't have access to email too. What are the options now ?Did I get it right? Â You woke up after three years of inactivity, but now cannot remember your password? How did you know it a few minutes ago? And, you cannot access your email account anymore? This is really fascinating case. I would love it if you could elaborate more on it.Quote from: hosseinimr93 on January 31, 2023, 07:33:48 PMYou can change your email address to a new one. ~He claims to have forgotten his password, so I am afraid that is not an option for him. (Not that i believe him anyway.)Quote from: Account Related SettingsFor security reasons, your current password is required to make changes to your account.

comments.author: ShowOff
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on January 31, 2023, 07:33:48 PMYou can change your email address to a new one. To do so, go to your profile, click "Account Related Settings" under "Modify Profile" at left side of the page and enter your new email address. Once you change your email address, an email will be sent to your old email address.How can the OP change it as long as he doesn't remember his current password. Any changes to Account Related Settings require password when you want to save changes. OP should probably check if the browser he's using is set to offer password saving, if it hasn't then I think he needs to enable it. But about cases like this, I have no experience. There must be a way to save him.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: "I forgot my wallet password and did not keep any backups, what should I do?"That's similar to what you're asking here.The forum tries as much as possible to mimick how bitcoun operates in privacy and autonomy. You are mean to back up your passwords, so you can always access your account. You can also use a throwaway email provider when creating your account.You can safely create a new account since you were not banned (presumably) and learn how to properly secure your account.

comments.author: T3PR00T
comments.body: Come on everyone. I am 100% sure the op is trolling. 5 posts made by the guy and he knows where to talk about forum stuffs.The username sounds sexydev. Check scan accusation topic about this user

comments.author: CryptoPanda
comments.body: Quote from: sexylun on January 31, 2023, 07:02:42 PMQuote from: PX-Z on January 31, 2023, 06:58:06 PMYou can just use the forgot password feature[1] of the forum. If you still have the access of your registered email, then follow the step in the email that will be sent to you.Note: Don't recover your account by answering your secret question, you will face more trouble[2][1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=reminder[2] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1206977.0I don't have access to email too. What are the options now ?You are in a dilemma, itâ€™s impossible to change oneâ€™s email address without the current password to the account. You can try to reset password if you have a secret question set. The other way to do this is to check your saved passwords on your browser or device, it should be there since youâ€™re automatically logged in each time you access the forum. I think thatâ€™s your best option at the moment.

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Quote from: sexylun on January 31, 2023, 06:54:41 PMI am in strange trouble at the moment. I am logged in my browser but i have forgotten the password.I will remain login as long as i don't logout. Is there any way i can recover my password ?The moment you logg out, that's the end...Don't you have an email attached to the forum? Cus everyone does.... You could actually check your BTT password from your saved passwords on your email -- this process will only a biometric and email-passcode verification, then it'll reveal 'em to you.I'm really seeing a huge risk or process if you actually don't have an access to your email account's passcode... Cus you're gonna get logged in but it will definitely be required on the long run.Sandra ðŸ§‘â€ðŸ¦°

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: sexylun on January 31, 2023, 06:54:41 PMI am in strange trouble at the moment. I am logged in my browser but i have forgotten the password.I will remain login as long as i don't logout. Is there any way i can recover my password ?Something is not right, perhaps you are lyingÂ  You just woke up today according to seclog, how is it possible you forget the password in that short time even after logging into the account after a long timeDo you have selective memory loss?

comments.author: skarais
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on January 31, 2023, 11:28:32 PMQuote from: sexylun on January 31, 2023, 06:54:41 PM~~~Something is not right, perhaps you are lying Â You just woke up today according to seclog, how is it possible you forget the password in that short time even after logging into the account after a long timeDo you have selective memory loss?There is always the possibility of forgetting the password because this OP is still newbie. The OP also registered his account with random email for whatever reason, and of course I don't think he really wants to use this account on regular basis. Then I can say that 3 to 4 months (the bare minimum of active state changes) is long time not to forget random password or any combination password, that's because the OP didn't backup or save them in the browser (probably they should).

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Stalker22 on January 31, 2023, 07:42:41 PMDid I get it right? Â You woke up after three years of inactivity, but now cannot remember your password? How did you know it a few minutes ago? And, you cannot access your email account anymore? Don't remember passwordNo access to emailNo signed message and a stake it in the forum or at least did not have any address posted on the forum which the member can still access it and sign a message from it. However, to do it, that address must come from a non custodial wallet which allows to sign messages.Combine them, it's impossible to recover the account.Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on January 31, 2023, 11:28:32 PMYou just woke up today according to seclog, how is it possible you forget the password in that short time even after logging into the account after a long timeI could be wrong about woke up.About last active time, if you try to log in your account, even it is failed, you will have an active status at the point of time. I am not sure about woke up but maybe it is shown only a member successfully log in his account, not failed.Quote from: achow101 on March 27, 2017, 05:34:41 PMIt shows up if a user has logged in with their last login time being at least 6 months ago.

comments.author: Ryker1
comments.body: Let us not judge OP for lying or anything because OP was inactive for how many years. Let us be friendly guys and guide those newbies wanted to ask questions and looking for answers.I assume that OP already log in to his account but forgot the password, yes --if you will log out from the current browser that you have used you will not recover it anymore because you don't have access to your email, go to [Account Related Settings] and change your email, it will perhaps work.If I were you OP, don't make things complicated, create another account since this your current account does not have activities and did not rank up [newbie status] --buy copper membership if needed to bypass newbie's restrictions such as posting images.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: Quote from: tranthidung on February 01, 2023, 11:17:53 AMDon't remember passwordNo access to emailNo signed message and a stake it in the forum or at least did not have any address posted on the forum which the member can still access it and sign a message from it. However, to do it, that address must come from a non custodial wallet which allows to sign messages.Combine them, it's impossible to recover the account.Yes I also think that way as he is not having any access like to his mails and don't know the password and moreover he has not staked the address so that he can verify by signing a message from that address and under these cases it's impossible to get the account back.Moreover as pointed above he just ask this after long period of inactivity which arises suspicion even more and newbie account which doesn't have anything special associated with it why he wants to recover it? But in any case I don't find any ways to have account recovery but he can try once.

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Quote from: sexylun on January 31, 2023, 06:54:41 PMI am in strange trouble at the moment. I am logged in my browser but i have forgotten the password.I will remain login as long as i don't logout. Is there any way i can recover my password ?What browser you are using because you might click save password on your account when you sign in to your browser. Try go on the settings>save password and check for Bitcointalk.org account info. Thereâ€™s no way to recover it using bitcointalk feature because it needs password to do any changes on your account settings. Your best chance is to check your browser if you save the data of your account when you login since browser always ask to save password the moment you login using the account that is still not saved.Itâ€™s very unusual to forget the password right after you login but I do understand you if you are using too complex password.

comments.author: skarais
comments.body: Quote from: Eternad on February 01, 2023, 04:48:41 PMWhat browser you are using because you might click save password on your account when you sign in to your browser. Try go on the settings>save password and check for Bitcointalk.org account info. Thereâ€™s no way to recover it using bitcointalk feature because it needs password to do any changes on your account settings. Your best chance is to check your browser if you save the data of your account when you login since browser always ask to save password the moment you login using the account that is still not saved.For people who are concerned about security and privacy, this step is definitely not recommended.Because of this, saving password in the browser is not recommended for strong security. Indeed, this step will make it easier for users to login, but of course it is not safe in the long term, especially if the device is easily accessible by other users.So far I've tried several ways to see how it works to get the OP to get the password, but all of them seem to be useless since normally the browser only asks once at login to save the password or not. So there's no other way, but what's the point of getting the newbie account password since basically the OP could just make more other accounts and leave this one without fuss.
